page.title: 13ST JOHN'S CHURCH, KNUTSFORD
page.content: This Georgian church was opened in 1744 and is almost 250 years old. Previously there was a church called St.Hellenas on the northside of Knutsford next to a street called Boothfields. Here you can see a grassed area which has tombstones on it, this is the churchyard of the old church, which served the whole of Knutsford. Since St.John the Baptist Church was opened in 1744 there has been one major alteration which took place in 1880. The Church has many activites like Sunday School(3-11), Pathfinders(11-14) and Eureka(14-18) The Church has four services a week. The age group of the congregation is from babies to 97 years old. There is a good response to all the churches activities and it plays an important part in Knutsford's life.
